moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4: I start with the queen's gambit, my usual
moves.4... Bf5 5. Bg5 Ne4: ?! Never move a piece twice in the opening
moves.6. Nxe4: I couldn't let him have that outpost.
moves.6... Bxe4 7. e3: I now have a pretty normal queen's gambit pawn structure.
moves.7... Nd7 8. Bd3 Bxf3: ?! Not only does this trade a bishop for a knight, it allows me to develop me queen.
moves.9. Qxf3: White is obviously better here. He has all his minor pieces and his queen developed to nice squares, (With the possible exception of my DSB.) and he has a healthy pawn structure.
moves.9... f6: ????? Looks like it is nothing more than an inaccuracy or possibly a mistake as it weakens the light squares... But
moves.10... g6 11. Bxg6+: Now, I could have played Qxg6, and it would have worked just as well, but I didn't think of it.
moves.11... hxg6 12. Qxg6#: Aaaaaaaaaaand MATE I don't usually get to get checkmates like this, so I had to annotate it. Please drop a comment and rate.
